column4: does ubuntu's installation allow make it easy to dualboot for windows or am i going to need partition magic or another program to do it?
Ubuntu will make a bootloader entry so you can select your OS at boot.
if Windows occupies the whole of your hard drive, you're going to have to repartition it.
it's difficult to compare execution speeds fairly under different OS's. I'd say subjectively, there won't be a noticable difference.
